business.headline: Sensex ends 120 points lower, Nifty below 25,900; SBI gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 120.21 points to close at 84,559.65, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 41.55 points to end at 25,818.55.

Zero GST on health insurance: What it means for your premium and your pocketFrom September 22, individual health and life insurance policies have become free from Goods and Services Tax, removing the 18% tax that policyholders were paying earlier.

8th Pay Commission: When will it be implemented and how much can you expect?The 8th Pay Commission has officially been set up, but the big questions remain unanswered. When will the new pay structure be implemented, and how much of a salary hike can central government employees realistically expect?

Silver rates reach new high: Why is it beating gold prices, and should you buy?On the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX), silver jumped over 4% during early trade. Around 9:20 am, MCX silver was trading 3.38% higher at Rs 2,04,445 per kg, touching a lifetime high.

What is the 70% salary rule and where the other 30% should go?Abhishek Walia urges individuals to base their spending only on verified take-home pay, warning that relying on bonuses or predicted increments leads to financial stress.

Planning to exit NPS? Here's how the new rules affect your retirement payoutThe pension regulator has eased NPS exit rules, allowing subscribers to access more of their money upfront. If retirement is around the corner, these changes could directly impact your final payout.

Vedanta shares in focus as it gets NCLT approval for demerger. Check detailsVedanta share price: The approval clears a key legal hurdle and allows the company to move ahead with splitting its businesses into multiple listed entities.
Sensex, Nifty open marginally higher as banking stocks rally in early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex was up by 91.32 points to 84,771.18, while the NSE Nifty50 added 44.40 points to 25,904.50 as of 9:22 am.
Bharat Taxi app to launch in Delhi from January 1The app is expected to provide relief to passengers who often face sharp fare increases on platforms such as Ola and Uber during peak hours.

Warner Bros likely to skip Paramount's $108.4 billion bid, back Netflix: ReportIf the board moves ahead with this recommendation, it would signal Warner Bros Discovery's preference to back Netflix's earlier buyout proposal instead of Paramount's all-cash offer.

ICICI Prudential AMC IPO allotment today: Check status, GMP, expected share priceInvestors who applied for the IPO can check their allotment status through the registrar, Kfin Technologies, or the BSE website once the allotment is finalised.

100% FDI in insurance explained: What it means for your policies, premiums and claimsWhat does allowing 100% foreign investment in insurance really mean for you as a policyholder, and could it change your premiums, policy features or claim experience? Find out here.

China Eastern Airlines to run daily flights on Delhi-Shanghai route from JanuaryFlight services between the two countries were suspended following the Covid-19 pandemic in 2020 and were not restored due to the over four-year border face-off in eastern Ladakh, which ended in October last year.

Rupee hits historic low of 91 against US dollar. What's behind this drop?The rupee breached the 91 mark against the US dollar for the first time on Tuesday, extending its run of losses amid sustained foreign fund outflows and market uncertainty.

Missed the December advance tax deadline? This is the interest you may have to payIf you missed the December advance tax deadline, don't panic just yet. There is no direct penalty, but interest will apply. Here's what the Income Tax Act says and how much it may cost you.
Sensex ends 533 points lower, Nifty below 25,900; Axis Bank down 5%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 533.50 points to close at 84,679.86, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 167.20 points to end at 25,860.10.

India loses billions yearly as global finance favours rich nations: ReportPoorer and emerging economies like India consistently pay more to the global financial system than they receive back, while rich countries continue to benefit from lower costs and higher returns.​

Will your loan EMI fall? SBI cuts lending rates, lowers interest on select FDThe State Bank of India has announced reductions in both lending and select deposit rates, aiming to balance relief for borrowers with steady returns for most deposit holders.

Gifts from family are tax-free. But who exactly qualifies as 'family'?Received money or property from a family member and assumed it is tax-free? Do you know whether the Income Tax Act actually treats that person as 'family'? Let's find out.

ICICI Prudential AMC IPO GMP today. Check allotment and listing detailsThe trend in the unofficial market has strengthened as the ICICI Prudential AMC IPO moved closer to closing, supported by improving subscription numbers across investor categories.

entertainment.headline: Housemaid first reviews: Critics say Sydney Sweeney film is over the top on purpose The Housemaid is a glossy crime thriller that has divided critics with its pulpy style and twist-packed storytelling. Led by a starry cast, the film leans into chaos and excess, offering a bold, indulgent watch that doesn't play by conventional rules.

Tisca Chopra's Directorial Debut: A Personal and Professional Challenge Tisca Chopra opened up about the personal and creative challenges she faced while co-writing and directing her first film, 'Saali Mohabbat'. Chopra said that intense creative differences with her husband, Sanjay Chopra, who co-wrote the film, nearly impacted their marriage.

Sreeleela urges action against AI deepfakes, calls for women's online dignity Sreeleela has spoken out against AI-generated harmful content on social media, calling for greater responsibility and support for women's safety in online spaces.

Jaideep Ahlawat says the tag of villain demeans well-written characters in cinema Actor Jaideep Ahlawat reflected on the Hindi film industry's obsession with the word "villain." He argued that it is demeaning to the character.

Rob Reiner's friends remember him in moving letter: His greatest gift was freedom Noted figures from the US comedy and film community, including Billy Crystal and Larry David, released a joint letter remembering director Rob Reiner and his wife Michele.

John Abraham and the macho face of patriotic Bollywood It's John Abraham's birthday today, and if there's one role he seems to return to again and again, it's that of the patriotic macho man – as the officer, the agent or the enforcer who is ready to sacrifice everything for the nation.

Did you know Taylor Swift helped Simu Liu plan his surprise proposal? Simu Liu enlisted Taylor Swift's help to surprise his fiancee, Allison Hsu, with a personal video message that played a special part in his Paris engagement.

Sofia Vergara confirms dating 39-year-old US businessman Douglas Chabbott Sofia Vergara acknowledged her relationship with American businessman Douglas Chabbott after a series of public appearances and growing media attention. The announcement, made via social media, follows months of rumours.

James Cameron to SS Rajamouli: I would love to come to your Varanasi set During an interaction with SS Rajamouli, director James Cameron expressed his interest towards visiting the sets of the former's upcoming film Varanasi. The duo spoke ahead of the release of Cameron's new film 'Avatar: Fire & Ash' (2025).

Fan asks Selena how she shaves her moustache, singer opens up about melasma Selena Gomez has responded to comments about her natural appearance in a recent makeup-free video, sharing her experience with melasma and offering candid advice on skin health and self-care.

Genelia D'Souza calls Riteish Deshmukh her heartbeat in birthday post Actor Genelia D'Souza marked her actor-husband Riteish Deshmukh's birthday on December 17. In her personal note, she described him as both a partner and a constant source of support.

26/11 Taj survivor reviews Dhurandhar's red screen scene, explains why it matters A woman who survived the 26/11 terror attacks at Mumbai's Taj Hotel reflected on her experience after viewing Aditya Dhar's Dhurandhar. The viral review highlighted the sequence, including real-life recordings of terrorists.

Akshaye Khanna performs havan amid Dhurandhar success, priest praises simplicity Actor Akshaye Khanna performed Vastu Shanti havan at his Alibaug home. A priest named Shivam Mhatre, shared the video on social media.

Shilpa Shetty rejects charges against Bastian Bengaluru, says justice will prevail Shilpa Shetty has responded to the case filed against Bastian Bengaluru. In a detailed statement shared on Instagram on Wednesday, the actor dismissed the allegations as baseless and urged the media to exercise restraint, stating that the matter is sub judice.

Is Pakistani film Mera Lyari an answer to India's Dhurandhar? Director clarifies Mera Lyari, a new Pakistani film set for release next month, claims to present an authentic perspective of Karachi's Lyari Town, countering narratives shown in the Indian film Dhurandhar.

Saif Ali Khan on why performing at weddings no longer feels right to him Saif Ali Khan discussed the reasons behind his decision to stop dancing at weddings. He addressed issues of class, comfort, and how the evolving nature of celebrity has shaped his approach to public appearances.

Neha Kakkar's Candy Shop triggers online backlash for vulgar lyrics, choreography Neha Kakkar's latest music release, Candy Shop, featuring her brother Tony Kakkar, has received widespread criticism on social media due to its suggestive lyrics and dance moves. The song's debut has sparked a debate among listeners, many of whom have expressed their disapproval online.

Homebound's Oscars moment explained: Shortlisted, not nominated - what it means Homebound makes the Oscars shortlist for Best International Feature Film. What does being shortlisted mean, how it differs from nominations, and what's next.

Ghaywan's Homebound deserves bigger legacy than Oscars: A home for shared humanity Neeraj Ghaywan's Homebound has been shortlisted for the Oscars. But Shoaib and Chandan's journey calls for an ideal legacy: homes rebuilt on unbreakable, shared humanity and compassion.

general news.headline: Can act against Delhi-NCR cars below BS-IV: Supreme Court modifies its own orderSupreme Court allows ban of old vehicles below BS-IV in Delhi-NCR, modfied its earlier order

Asim Munir's big test as Trump pushes Pakistan to send troops to GazaAsim Munir, who is now Pakistan's chief of defence forces, is expected to fly to Washington to meet President Donald Trump in the coming weeks. The meeting will likely focus on the Gaza stabilisation force.

Delhi air crisis: India gets an unsolicited but timely tutorial from ChinaDelhi pollution: Noting that China and India know the struggle with air pollution, the Chinese embassy has offered help to Delhi by posting a step-by-step guide on how Beijing came out of the crisis.

Is this Bengal's Assam-like NRC moment?West Bengal's Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of voter rolls echoes Assam's NRC in intent but, the results were surprising. Despite political expectations of mass deletions and demographic shifts, the draft list showed minimal changes in Muslim-majority districts and higher deletions in Matua and Hindi-speaking areas.

54 Indian soldiers who went missing during the 1971 war never returned homeIndia declared 54 personnel from the three services as 'missing in action' after the 1971 war — men who never made their way back home. Fifty-four years have passed, yet no definitive trace has been found. From Indira Gandhi to Narendra Modi, families of the missing have approached successive prime ministers, hoping for movement, but little has changed.

Railways to allow ticket status check 10 hours before train departurePassengers will now know their train ticket reservation status well in advance as Indian Railways revises chart preparation timings, enabling confirmation details to be available up to 10 hours before the scheduled departure.

Game over for Mamata Banerjee, says BJP on SIR deletionsThe Election Commission of India recently released the draft electoral rolls for poll-bound West Bengal following the contentious SIR exercise identifying over 58 lakh voters for deletion from the electoral rolls.

Is Pakistani film Mera Lyari an answer to India's Dhurandhar? Director clarifiesMera Lyari, a new Pakistani film set for release next month, claims to present an authentic perspective of Karachi's Lyari Town, countering narratives shown in the Indian film Dhurandhar.

Iran's Hormuz coast turned blood-red overnight. Science explains whyLocated in the Persian Gulf near the Strait of Hormuz, this small island is already famous for its dramatic landscape and kaleidoscopic geology.

Function at 50% WFH or pay fine: Delhi's mandate to all firms amid air crisisThe Delhi government on Wednesday mandated all government and private companies to function at a 50 per cent work from home mode amid the air pollution crisis.

Bangladesh envoy summoned after threat to India mission, Seven Sisters remarkThe summons to the Bangladesh High Commissioner comes a day after a Bangladeshi leader threatened to isolate the Seven Sisters, referring to the north-eastern states.
Supreme Court suggests shutting Delhi toll booths to avoid jams, curb pollutionNightmare of traffic: Supreme Court urges suspending toll collection at Delhi borders to curb pollution

James Cameron to SS Rajamouli: I would love to come to your Varanasi setDuring an interaction with SS Rajamouli, director James Cameron expressed his interest towards visiting the sets of the former's upcoming film Varanasi. The duo spoke ahead of the release of Cameron's new film 'Avatar: Fire & Ash' (2025).

Rahul Gandhi visits BMW site in Germany, says need to boost manufacturing in IndiaDuring his visit to Germany, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi addressed India's manufacturing challenges, underscoring the importance of increasing production to drive economic growth. He also visited a BMW factory, expressing admiration for the presence of Indian-made products and meeting with Indian Overseas Congress representatives in Berlin.

Why Bangladesh's threat of isolating Seven Sisters from India is just a fantasyCan Bangladesh actually sever these states from the Indian mainland? Here's an analysis of the geographical, political and strategic realities.

Can Delhi copy China's clean-air fix? Yes, but only on paperBeijing's clean-air playbook offers clear lessons for Delhi, but political, economic and social realities make full-scale implementation extremely difficult in India's capital.

Homebound's Oscars moment explained: Shortlisted, not nominated - what it meansHomebound makes the Oscars shortlist for Best International Feature Film. What does being shortlisted mean, how it differs from nominations, and what's next.

Bondi Beach shooter wakes up from coma, arrested at bedside for terror, murdersNaveed Akram, the surviving Bondi Beach terrorist, came out of coma and was arrested at the bedside at a hospital in Australia. He has been charged with one count of terror and 15 murders. Naveed survived while his father Sajid Akram, originally from India, was shot dead by the police as the duo killed 15 civilians.

VB-G RAM G Bill vs MGNREGA: 5 big changes explainedGovernment schemes are often difficult to understand. This is all you need to know about the VB-G RAM G rural jobs scheme that the government plans to replace the two-decade-old MGNREGA with. This 5-point explainer will help you comprehend the two schemes and win debates.

Severe AQI, empty offices: 45% pollution control board posts lie vacantNearly 45% of scientific and technical posts in India's pollution control boards are vacant even as cities battle severe air quality. Parliament data shows chronic staff shortages across central and state boards, raising serious questions about monitoring, enforcement and why pollution has quietly become a normal part of urban life.

26/11 Taj survivor reviews Dhurandhar's red screen scene, explains why it mattersA woman who survived the 26/11 terror attacks at Mumbai's Taj Hotel reflected on her experience after viewing Aditya Dhar's Dhurandhar. The viral review highlighted the sequence, including real-life recordings of terrorists.

Explained: Row over Trump aide's description of President's 'alcoholic personality'A Vanity Fair profile of White House Chief of Staff Susie Wiles has sparked political turmoil due to her candid remarks about Trump's personality. But it also shows the President prefers loyalty to everything else.

Luthras taken to Goa, cops say they had ultimate control over club operationsGoa Police, while seeking transit remand, said the Luthra brothers were the main owners of the nightclub, where a fire killed 25 people, and had 'ultimate control' over the operation and safety arrangement.

Shy bowel syndrome is real: Why some people can only poop at homeBreaking wind in public washrooms, the time you spend when taking a dump in the office toilet – all of it can become a point of anxiety for some people. And that makes their bowel shy.  Experts agree.

sports.headline: Snicko chaos in Ashes Adelaide Test: Why England were left fuming England were left fuming at the end of Day 1 of the Adelaide Test as Alex Carey admitted that he got a lucky break as the Snicko came to the rescue of the Australian wicketkeeper on Wednesday, December 17.

Duck for Green, Livingstone shines: How IPL auction's top buys fared in last 24 hours? IPL 2026 auction: From a match-winning 76 to a first-ball duck, IPL auction's biggest buys were under the spotlight within 24 hours. Here's how the league's costliest signings fared immediately after the hammer fell.

Former India fielding coach joins Sri Lanka ahead of T20 World Cup 2026 Former India fielding coach R. Sridhar has been appointed Sri Lanka's fielding coach until March 2026 to sharpen their on-field standards ahead of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup co-hosted by India and Sri Lanka.

Hit-and-miss bowler? KKR's Pathirana move labelled gamble by Kris Srikkanth Former Indian captain Kris Srikkanth has voiced concerns about Kolkata Knight Riders' high-profile purchase of Sri Lankan pacer Matheesha Pathirana, highlighting risks associated with getting the Sri Lankan pacer.

Alex Carey pays emotional tribute to late father after maiden Ashes century Alex Carey marked a deeply emotional milestone by scoring his maiden Ashes century at his home ground in Adelaide, paying tribute to his late father after ending a long wait for a hundred in the series.

Varun Chakravarthy breaks Bumrah's record, achieves new high in T20I rankings Varun Chakravarthy has become the highest-rated Indian bowler in ICC T20I rankings. He surpassed Jasprit Bumrah's feat from 2017 against England.

At some point MS Dhoni will move on: Fleming on CSK's trade to bring in Sanju Samson IPL 2026: Chennai Super Kings have begun planning for life after MS Dhoni, with the trade for Sanju Samson signalling a clear shift towards succession planning and a younger, future-focused squad.

Watch: Rohit recalls heated exchange with Steve Smith in 2014-15 Australia tour Rohit Sharma recalled a heated on-field exchange with Steve Smith during the 2014–15 Border-Gavaskar Trophy in Australia, sparked by an LBW appeal while he was bowling part-time.

CWG 2030 in Ahmedabad to unlock India's potential: World Athletics' Sebastian Coe World Athletics chief Sebastian Coe emphasises the strategic significance of India and the reintroduction of historic athletic events ahead of the 2030 Commonwealth Games in Ahmedabad.

Alex Carey, Usman Khawaja lift Australia after Archer burst on a day of remembrance The Ashes, 3rd Test Day 1: Emotion hung heavy over Adelaide as Alex Carey's defiant Ashes hundred lifted Australia to 326/8 on a day shaped by remembrance, an Archer-led new-ball burst, and a timely Khawaja comeback.

Irfan Pathan praises KKR's Pathirana deal, says they have perfect IPL bowling attack KKR strengthened their IPL 2026 bowling attack by acquiring Matheesha Pathirana for Rs 18 crore in the auction on Tuesday, creating a balanced lineup across all phases of a T20 innings.

Messi's big message after GOAT tour: Hope Indian football has a bright futureLionel Messi visited India, inspiring fans across four cities during his whirlwind tour. His visit highlighted both football's growing popularity and current challenges in Indian football.

Yashasvi Jaiswal hospitalised with stomach cramps during domestic T20 in PuneIndia batter Yashasvi Jaiswal was hospitalised with acute gastroenteritis after the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy match between Mumbai and Rajasthan in Pune.

Cameron Green a generational talent, CSK missed a trick letting him go: R AshwinR Ashwin said CSK showed a lack of intent at the IPL 2026 mini-auction, allowing KKR to snap up generational all-rounder Cameron Green for a record Rs 25.20 crore, a move he hailed as an outstanding buy.

IPL auction: Sarthak Ranjan, son of Congress leader Pappu Yadav picked up by KKRKKR's IPL 2026 auction included a notable off-field moment as the franchise signed Sarthak Ranjan, son of former MP and Congress leader Pappu Yadav, prompting an emotional reaction from the Bihar politician.

Prithvi Shaw's 2nd chance: DC co-owner on why they bid for Maharashtra batterDC co-owner Kiran Kumar Grandhi explained why the franchise decided to bring back Prithvi Shaw into the side during the IPL 2026 auction. Shaw was bought back by DC for his base price of Rs. 75 Lakh.

Joe Burns snubbed for Italy's maiden T20 World Cup campaign in India and Sri LankaT20 World Cup 2026: The Italian Cricket Federation has confirmed Wayne Madsen as the new captain of the men's T20 team, replacing Joe Burns, who will not be part of the squad for the upcoming ICC Men's T20 World Cup.

Auqib Nabi's 8.4 crore deal in IPL auction gives J&K cricket the hope it needsAt 29, Auqib Nabi Dar turned years of waiting into an IPL breakthrough, carrying the Valley with him and giving J&K cricket a moment it had long dreamed of.

Australia, England players pay homage to Bondi beach terror attack victimsAustralia and England cricket teams paid respects to the Bondi beach attack victims on Day 1 of the third Ashes Test at the Adelaide Oval. Fifteen civilians were killed and dozens injured on Sunday at Bondi Beach after two men opened fire, targeting members of the Jewish community.

Dad's Army to T20 babies: CSK reset DNA, but did they get the auction wrong?IPL auction 2026: A radical shift in philosophy has turned the Dad's Army into a nursery. But with a surplus of batters and a void at the death, have CSK sacrificed balance for youth?

4th T20I: Suryakumar, Gill under the pump as India eye series win in LucknowIndia will look to clinch the T20I series against South Africa in the fourth match in Lucknow on December 17. The spotlight will be once again on Shubman Gill and Suryakumar Yadav's form as the team prepares for the T20 World Cup 2026 on home soil.

IPL auction: Why uncapped Indian stars sold like hot cakes in Abu DhabiThe IPL 2026 auction saw teams deviate from their usual approach and splash the cash on uncapped Indian talent. With names like Prashant Veer and Kartik Sharma stealing the spotlight, here a look at why uncapped stars went for big money during the auction on December 16.

Ashes: Why Khawaja is playing after being left out of Xi on eve of 3rd TestUsman Khawaja was a late inclusion in Australia's playing XI for the third Ashes Test in Adelaide after Steve Smith was ruled out due to illness. Khawaja was slotted in to Smith's number four spot in the batting lineup.

IPL 2026 auction report card: Rating the squads of all 10 teamsIPL 2026 mini-auction: Big money, bold calls and surprise steals defined the Abu Dhabi show, where all 10 teams finalised their squads after a series of fierce bidding wars on December 16. While some franchises splurged on marquee names, uncapped Indian players were also among the biggest winners as teams looked to strengthen their core. Here's how all 10 squads shaped up after an intense eight-hour auction marathon.

IPL 2026 auction review: 10 things we learnt from bidding wars in Abu DhabiIPL Auction: The Indian Premier League mini-auction saw a total of 77 players being sold on Tuesday. Here is a concise review of the event in 10 points. From trust in uncapped players to unique auction strategies, here's everything that unfolded in Abu Dhabi on December 15.

MS Dhoni will surely retire: Ex-CSK teammate makes big claim after mini-auctionIPL 2026 auction: Former CSK batter Robin Uthappa says MS Dhoni's final act is imminent, citing the franchise's youth-focused auction strategy as a clear sign of the legend's impending transition to a mentor role.

Forever grateful to Dhoni bhai, CSK: Pathirana's emotional note to ChennaiMatheesha wrote an emotional message to CSK, MS Dhoni and fans of Chennai after the Sri Lankan pacer moved on to join KKR during the IPL 2026 auction on Tuesday, December 26. Pathirana spent four seasons with CSK.

If corporates, fans can pay for Messi, they can back Indian football: BhaichungSpeaking to India Today's Consulting Editor Rajdeep Sardesai, Indian football great Bhaichung Bhutia urged corporates and fans, who paid big money to watch Lionel Messi on his GOAT tour in India, to support Indian football.

IPL 2026 Auction: Meet Prashant Veer, The ₹14.20 Crore Uncapped Star Bought By CSKIn this special report, RD INDIA TODAY speaks to Prashant Veer, the uncapped cricketer from Uttar Pradesh who created history at the IPL 2026 auction. The 20-year-old all-rounder was bought by Chennai Super Kings (CSK) for a staggering ₹14.20 crore. Prashant shares his excitement about joining his 'dream team' and the prospect of sharing the dressing room with MS Dhoni. He says, 'I am very excited to meet Dhoni. I will try to learn as much as I can from him.' He reflects on his journey from the UP T20 League, where he shone for Noida Super Kings, to becoming one of the most expensive uncapped players. He also credits his coach Raju Goyal and the UPCA for their support.

Messi meets tradition and tigers at Anant Ambani's Vantara: See picsVantara founder Anant Ambani hosted global football icon Lionel Messi at the wildlife rescue, rehabilitation and conservation centre, where the football legend's time was marked by guided tours, traditional rituals and close interactions with wildlife.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
